title: Clarify load shedding documentation
body:
### Describe the bug

I read the load shedding documentation and left not knowing exactly what it is a how to use it. I could not get a high level understanding to explaining on a podcast as news item or know whether I wanted to investigate.

I think the first section should be a description of the concept of load shedding

* what is its practical use
* what set of problems does it solve
* with what benefit
* how does it solve it at high level
* when would I want to use it vs back pressure
* how is load shedding different from an overloaded server that no longer answer requests

I imagine something like a half a page to a page worth of explanation. and a couple of external resources to get more info.

Section 2 describes the algorithm which is almost like a readout of the implementation. A documentation that would describe the high level moving parts, the configuration options, what impact a config change has, why one would set a higher or lower value, how to find he best value for ones app, etc, such a doc would be the most practically useful from a user wanting to enable load shedding on its Quarkus app.

I hope these explanations help on improving the doc.
